'''Iwan Rheon''' is a Welsh actor and musician.  

"Iwan" is pronounced "Eye-One", not "Eye-Wan" (it's pronounced like the "Wan" in "Obi-Wan Kenobi").  

Rheon had a lead role in ''Misfits''. He is in the upcoming movies ''Wasteland'' and ''Libertador''. He also had a recurring role in the first and second seasons of Simon Amstell's sitcom ''Grandma's House'' as Simon's self-involved boyfriend, Ben.

He was cast for the [[Season 3|third season]] of ''Game of Thrones'' in the role of [[Ramsay Snow]]. He was announced in the role on July 20, 2012, though the character was initially referred only as "Boy", to keep his identity secret.<ref name="WiC Iwan">[http://winteriscoming.net/2012/07/iwan-rheon-cast-in-game-of-thrones/ "Iwan Rheon cast in Game of Thrones"], Winter is Coming.net, July 20, 2012</ref>

In the DVD commentary for Season 3 episode 3 "[[Walk of Punishment]]", executive producers [[David Benioff]] and [[Dan Weiss]] revealed that Iwan was actually their runner-up second choice to play [[Jon Snow]], one of the main ''heroes'' of the story. In many ways, Ramsay Snow is a foil to Jon Snow: just as the Boltons are the "bad" counterpart to the "good" Starks in the North, both of them are the bastard sons of the head of their Houses.

He was promoted to starring cast member for the [[Season 4|fourth]] season, and his name was added to the opening credits as of "[[The Lion and the Rose]]".

Rheon reprised his role as Ramsay in ''[[Game of Thrones: A Telltale Games Series]]''.
